intro: Plukenetia madagascariensis, commonly known as Madagascar butternut, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-green fruit, which resembles a small, round nut. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The fruit is edible and has been used traditionally for its nutritional value and culinary applications.
